headline.main: YELLOW FEVER AT QUARANTINE.; Consternation Among the People of States Island-Several Fatal Cases-A Vigilance Committee Appointed.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are now lying in Quarantine some 120 sail of vessels, most of which are from ports where the yellow fever existed at the time of their sailing, or usually does at this season of the year.
docs.snippet: There are now lying in Quarantine some 120 sail of vessels, most of which are from ports where the yellow fever existed at the time of their sailing, or usually does at this season of the year.

headline.main: MUNICIPAL AFFAIRS.; Mr. Irving in his own Defence-Miscellaneous. THE ALDERMEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The session of the Supervisors having been prolonged to an unusually late hour, is was evening before the same body assembled as Aldermen. Mr. IRVING, Superintendent of Repairs and Supplies, sent in the following communication: OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF REPAIRS TO PUBLIC BUILDINGS, NEW-YORK, August 8, 1856. OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF REPAIRS TO PUBLIC BUILDINGS, NEW-YORK, AUGUST 8, 1856.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although interest concentrates more particularly, at the present moment, in the intelligence which is received from Spain, it can scarcely be doubted that clouds have been gradually gathering over other nations in Europe, and that outbreaks are scarcely less imminent now than they were in the early part of 1848.

headline.main: SARATOGA.; Personalities--Politicians--Artists-Merchasts--Musicians-La Grange--Gotts-Chaik-The Van Burens-Brilliant Ball at Congress Hall--Hen, Woman and Things.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some people expect letters from Saratoga to chronicle the names of those who come, that they may know whom to expect to meet when they arrive. Some people profess to be very indignant when, they see their own names chronicled, and others, in greater numbers, are still more indignant if they are considered "not worth mentioning." It is very difficult to please everybody,

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Health had a meeting, yesterday, to take into consideration the subject of raising money to defray the expenses of streetcleaning; all the appropriaton for 1856, for that purpose, having been used up by Mr. EuLING, the Commissioner of Streets and Lamps.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; COTTON FIRM--BREADSTUFFS UNSTEADY. Consols 95 3-4 95 7-8. THE NEW GOVERNMENT AND PROSPECTS OF ITS DURATION. ARRIVAL OF THE ASIA. Desperate Fighting at Barcelona. The Coup D' Eiat in Spain. OUR PARIS CORRESPONDENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British and North American Mail steamer Asia, from Liverpool soon after 2 o'clock P. M. of Saturday, the 26th ult., arrived at this port yesterday afternoon. The Cunard steamer Zebra, plying between Liverpool and Havre, went ashore on the Lizard Point. Crew and passengers saved, as also portions of the cargo, but the ship remains full of water.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; New-York Academy of Medicine--Discussion on Yellow Fever. SANITARY CONDITION OF THE CITY. Funeral Services of the late John Griswold. Ab??tement of Nuisa??ces. Burning Bedding and Furaliure of Infected Vessels. The Wallmarket Outaping Ground. The Health Commissioners. Seizure of Letters.

docs.lead_paragraph: The regular Monthly Meeting of the New-York Academy of Medicine, was hold on Wednesday evening in the small Chapel of the University. The President, Dr. WILLARD PARKER, in the chair. Dr. FAIR, of Columbia, S. C., was introduced to the Society, and after some immaterial business was concluded, the election of some half-dozen new members, , be was requested to give any information to the Academy pertinent to the present threatening epidemic.
